title: Love it
comment: Wanted Google play to automatically start when it connects to my vehicle... Works perfectly and have installed this app on my s4 and s6...love it!

title: Perfect
comment: Works fine can here phone through parrot ck3100 now. Does disable my home button on galaxy s4 though when connected but don't need it when driving

title: Works perfectly!
comment: Fixes my Bluetooth issues while I'm on the road!   Connects and opens slacker,  then closes slacker when I disconnect.

title: Nope
comment: Drained my battery and did nothing to cease the volume helper re-enabled by Lollipop.

No app can stop that annoying volume warning message.  On most devices, you just need to acknowledge that message once per boot. When you do boot, connect to a BT device to clear that message.   Complain loudly to your device manufacturer to remove that message.  I have and I hope everyone else does as well.

title: Amazing Bluetooth volume app
comment: Woooooow! 😀
Can't get the volume past the safety warning.

No app can stop that annoying volume warning message. On most devices, you just need to acknowledge that message once per boot. When you do boot, connect to a BT device to clear that message. Complain loudly to your device manufacturer to remove that message. I have and I hope everyone else does as well.

title: great for car
comment: Only app which works via car speakers, had to repair Bluetooth as per instructions. would love option to reply to text via speech.

comment: This app does absolutely nothing for my phone's volume while using Bluetooth. Still unable to change the volume on any app connected to my Bluetooth speaker. Lollipop ruined my phone...

No app can stop that annoying volume warning message. On most devices, you just need to acknowledge that message once per boot. When you do boot, connect to a BT device to clear that message. Complain loudly to your device manufacturer to remove that message. I have and I hope everyone else does as well.
Yeee! It works like charm!

title: Old video for 1
comment: Need to update your video, doesn't match the app at all....  Also should rename to audio for car or something.  Doesn't help for phone to headset....way to many menu choices for a simple headset to phone connection

Agree on the video.  It can be configured for headsets too: https://github.com/jroal/a2dpvolume/wiki/Manual .  I valued configuration over simplicity. App is free, open source, no ads. Is it really fair to 1 star it because it was not exactly what you want?

title: Great apps
comment: This app is perfect and it solve my problem for launching an app and change volume, juste one feature and it will be do everything for me.  Could you add to this app a option to change the screen brightness auto to 100% ?

title: Well done!
comment: Excellent app, I was really just looking for something to auto-disable WiFi when I connect to car BT, but all the additional features are really handy too (ie. Location saving when leaving your car).  Also, the complete lack of ads is VERY much appreciated! Keep up the good work, Author!

I'm not sure this is wat I'm looking 4.wen I connect my galaxy s5 to my head unit in my car it will play for a while then all of the sudden  disconnect so every time it does this it fights with me to reconnect to head unit.not sure y any suggestions?

title: It works but...
comment: It will put the phone in Handsfree mode but will not take it out of Handsfree mode. Annoying when I leave my car and dock the phone at my desk.

title: Solved my problem with Lollipop/car audio!
comment: This app seems to have solved my pain with Galaxy S5 only connecting call audio after the Lollipop update. The media audio refused to connect to car bluetooth, thus making it impossible to play music from the phone through the car stereo. Using this app's "also connect to..." option the media audio gets connected automatically. I only have tested it 2 days, but so far it seems it does the job perfectly!
Top. Solved A2DP on bluetooth function on home theatre reciever.

title: Well guess I'll keep looking
comment: Set everything I wanted the app to do and after I restarted my phone, everything works perfect. Update! Nevermind, I wrote the review before the bugs came out to play with my phone.

title: Great!
comment: Works great, ad free, open source, and it's free. What more could you ask for?

title: Doesn't work
comment: Trying to set maximum volume when connected to my Bluetooth headset but it absolutely will not remember my setting, reverting to 70-80% every time I reconnect my device. Waste of time.

title: Scary good
comment: I didn't expect to get so much use out of this! Since you can configure it by device, you can have it do one thing for a headset and something different for each car, etc. I picked it up to read me texts in the car, and its soft-spoken yet powerful features have left me impressed.
Great app that resolved an annoying issue. Thanks

title: Solves my problem
comment: I've been using this app for a while and by and large it solves my problem of connecting to my car's (2013 Camaro with MyLink - old style) Bluetooth to my phone when I forget to turn off my Bluetooth headset.  There is this annoying bug wherein if I enter my car with my Bluetooth headset (LG HBS-730) connected to the media and I fail to power it off or disconnect the media before my car's radio attempts to connect to Bluetooth then I can never get the car's Bluetooth to connect the media unless I first turn off the car and open the door to drop the Bluetooth connection then wait up to a minute and a 1/2 before turning the car on again!  Ugh, still breaks but less often.

title: Handy
comment: Such a handy little program, regardless of what version of Android you're using . Automation upon connection is very handy.

title: Must have
comment: This app really fills a gap that android should be handling. Awesome work

title: Reaaaallllly Mo Fokin' Niii>i!!!!!!ce
comment: Say Somethin'

title: Should be a part of native Android.
comment: I had been searching for an app that does everything this does. Just what I needed. Google should include this functionality in Android by default.

title: Solves BT problem
comment: This app effectively deals with a problem these was having with low music volume when playing back over BT through my car stereo

title: A2DP
comment: Does what it says on the tin. Great but remember to shut all apps after download then reopen and all is fine.

title: Julia Johnson
comment: I just purchased the Motorola SF500 Wireless Buds which supports Bluetooth A2DP (previous had the LG-Tones).  I have been searching for several days  to find the perfect app that was compatible with the buds and that would read my text messages, mail etc through the headset. (I tried a lot of android apps, all of which were confusing and way to complicated not to mention they didn't work with my device).  I was super excited when I came across this app and read all the positive reviews and even more excited to see the instructions from Jim Roal - Thank you Jim. Finally, I was able to follow the instructions with no problems (thanks to the added link Jim provided with his review). I need to point out that I had to turn off my Bluetooth from my phone and back on for everything to work properly. Then I was doing the "Happy Dance"  it worked, it worked - I am a Happy Customer now!

title: Not sure if it is working or not
comment: I've used this on a different phone, but currently am on a Moto G on Android 4.4.4 and I can't really detect that it is working.  In particular, the TTS voice doesn't seem to read out notifications anymore, and I don't see an icon in the top bar which I'm sure I used to do.  I suspect that the service is starting / stopping a lot, as I often see popup notifications telling me that the service has started, which I think I'd only expect to normally see when I first boot the phone. If I can help to debug these issues somehow, I'd be grateful to help! Edit - this could just be me not setting the Apps for Accessibility up properly!

title: Media Volume not setting properly on Moto X
comment: I have an unlocked Moto X (on T-Mobile). I have a 2014 Mazda 3. I configured this app to change the Media Volume to max every time it connected to the Mazda.   Although it detects it connecting to the Mazda, and then subsequently changes the Media volume, it never changed it to the correct volume.  Sometimes it would set the volume to 5 (of 15), other times to 7, and other times to 10; not once did it ever properly set the Media Volume to 15.  Given that I couldn't get yours to work, I decided to use the LLama app instead; Llama, although a more complex user interface, does successfully set the Media Volume to max each time.
Be careful as Motorola devices block the ability to set the volume on the first attempt after boot.

title: Nice
comment: Love it

title: Doesn't Work with LG G3
comment: As the title says, it doesn't work with the LG G3 when it comes to reading texts via Bluetooth. I tried all of the recommendations on the page linked in the description and no dice. I really miss this features  when I had my old Lumia 928 (one of the only good things about it) and am struggling to find a similar service for my new phone.

This can be tricky on some devices.  Based on your description I presume you tried these tips: https://code.google.com/p/a2dpvolume/w/list .  It has been tested with mostly Motorola and Samsung devices and works with those.  I don't have an LG device to test with.  Sorry it did not work for you.

title: Love it
comment: Fantastically easy interfacibility with any device. Easy, logical  and intuitively set up for easy use. Try it you will love it too.

title: Great app
comment: Thank you Jim!  This app so far seems to have fixed the dropped Bluetooth connections and loss of streaming audio sound between my Verizon Moto X running Kit Kat 4.4.2 and Subaru Forester's car stereo.  I encountered one or both of these problems daily for the past two months until installing this app. For what it's worth I also seem to have the best results with Bluetooth connectivity if I turn off WiFi, start the car, and then turn on Bluetooth in that order.

title: working great
comment: Now reading texts correctly, I had alarm stream selected, which read through the phone speaker not Bluetooth

Did you try this: https://code.google.com/p/a2dpvolume/wiki/Accessibility_Settings and this https://code.google.com/p/a2dpvolume/wiki/Reading_SMS ?. If you use Hangouts for SMS, just use the accessibility method, not both.

title: Frank
comment: Simple and convenient!

title: OMG!  I love this app for an obscure feature
comment: This app permits me to disable wifi upon connecting to a specific Bluetooth device.  In my case, that's my car.  I need this because my phone is a total wifi horndog.  If it spots wifi it's all over it, but that doesn't work very well when you're on the road.  Stop at a red light and that phone is trying to knock up the nearest wifi access point, at the expense of a useful cellular data connection. NOW, I don't have that happening, and as a bonus, I can specify my favorite driving app to start too!
Great app!

title: Perfect
comment: Works perfectly on my cowon Z2, I was getting annoyed at having to manually reconnect to my kenwood bluetooth car stereo, so went looking for an ap to do it for me, and this one does it perfectly.  I am a mail carrier, and now when i turn off the vehicle (30-50 times a day), it pauses the audio, and restarts it automatically when the Z2 reconnects (only drawback, this takes about 15 seconds).   To all the people rating this low, please find out what the app is supposed to do before you rate it down.

title: Great App
comment: This is a great app, I couldn't no matter how hard I tried get my Huawei Ascend Y201 to have any volume in my Toyota Aurion for hands free until I downloaded this app and I could also get my music played through my car, recently I had some upgrades on my phone and I lost the volume for my music, that's okay I purchased an Aux cable and now that's fixed, but when I make a phone call or receive one I can't hear through the hands free any help greatly appreciated.  Thanks so much for your reply, I tried what you mentioned and I started getting my music again, but couldn't get my phone volume, sitting in the Dr's waiting room fiddling with phone and a light went on, out to the car and going through Tasker I put Start Phone and low and behold we have volume. yay!!! Thank you so much, me and my cheap smartphone love it :) Yep found that as well thank you Jim. :)
This app can also set your call volume.  Click on the device in the list (in the app) and edit.  Then set the in-call volume while connected.

title: Didn't work
comment: I didn't notice any difference in the quality if how the music played on my phone having this app installed.  Still experienced pauses in music with this on.

How did you configure it?  You need to set your preferences and configure each device you connect to.  Just installing it does nothing.  The pauses can often be corrected using the disable wifi when connected feature.  In the app click the "find devices" button.  Click each device to edit the settings for that device.

title: Ok FOSS (was: more and more permissions)
comment: (Was: Why Google talk permission is needed?  The devs should have an easy found complete list of permissions needed with reasoning why each permission is needed. I just had enough. Seems like spying to require so much permissions.) Good reply from the author. Google Play should always show a direct link to the reasoning for perms for every app....and would not accept if reasons given are too general.

Google Talk permission is needed for the Google Talk integration.  I post all the permission reasons here: http://code.google.com/p/a2dpvolume/wiki/Permissions
This app is open source so all can view the source code.  Every permission is required to support the features of the app.

title: A2dp restarts FIXED tks Jim!
comment: App restart fixed, as suggested set app to priority! Your the man!
That generally happens with the OS kills the app to run other apps in the foreground.  When memory opens up again, it will restart A2DP Volume.
Just works
Doesn't work from an appradio 3

This app does not pair Bluetooth devices.  You do that in the Android settings screen. Please clarify "doesn't work".  Post defects and enhancement requests here: http://code.google.com/p/a2dpvolume/issues/list?cursor=a2dpvolume

title: Great app, works just as advertised

title: Didn't work
comment: It dropped the volume down when I connected to a Bluetooth device, not what I configured.

There is a feature in the app to automatically remember last used media volume. If you have Android 4.1 or higher, the volume is already set to the level it was when last connected.  This may happen before or after A2DP Volume tries to also set the volume.  It is recommended that you let Android manage the volume on 4.1 and newer.

title: A2DP Volume app - fixes a major BT audio problem.
comment: Before installing this app: I would have to raise my BT audio input level adjustment all the way, to make the BT audio the same volume as the car radio.  Either that, or raise the volume of the phone, which is never at the right setting for playing music in the car.  After installing this app: My phone raises the volume to the desired level every time, and I was able to turn down my BT audio input level adjustment to the neutral setting (neither raise or lower input level). title: Awesome, fixed my autoconnect problem and more!
comment: This is an awesome little app.  I won't go into detail about all of its features but this app did fix the fact that my phone would not autoconnect with my car headunit.    Here's the fix using this app:  Click on the connection that is listed there for your headunit (mine says "Xplod" since it's a Sony). Write down the MAC address it shows. Click "edit" Scroll down to where it says "Also connect to bluetooth device" and enter that MAC address. Click on "save".  It works great and there are many other features in this app that have me giddy to go and play with.

title: Where has this been all my life?!
comment: Jimroal is my hero :)

title: Must have if having AVRCP problems with stereo
comment: My phone used to respond flawlessly to the bluetooth media control buttons on my car stereo flawlessly.  Recently, for some reason it stopped working in an ideal way.  I used to be able to get in my car, phone and stereo auto-pair, and then I could press play, next, or previous on my stereo and it would work as you would hope it would.  Then it started messing up to where I had to pull my phone out every time and manually start the Music app every time.  This was was becoming very annoying.  Then A2DP to the rescue!  Not only did it allow me to configure it to auto start the music app when it connects to my stereo, but it also let me configure what the media volume should be.  This is something that was also a nuisance due to the fact the bluetooth media volume would be at whatever the last media volume on the phone was. Sometimes it would be too high, but more often it would be way too low.  A2DP volume fixed that issue.  Even if the initial problem were to be resolved, I would leave this app on my phone for the auto volume feature.  This will be a new addition to my collection of standard apps on any of my Android devices.
